Since she’s been gone
 I want no one to talk to me
George has been left by the girl he loves and is so down by this he doesn’t want to talk to anyone and wishes to be left in solitude

So go away, leave me alone
 Don’t bother me

“Don’t Bother Me” I wrote in a hotel in Bournemouth, where we were playing a summer season in 1963, as an exercise to see if I could write a song. I was sick in bed.
- George Harrison, Anthology
